Yes loved the game, little bit long to level but in the end very worth it seeing how far you came, very mechanical and methodical game able to be played with friends and family alike. Anyone interested in a low internet needed highly technical and fun game to play with others or yourself alike, highly recommended even to spend money on most of the dlc because the characters are just really well made, built and unique and include interesting aspects about them like descriptions, perks, and following horror relevance and background to very interesting movies, shows and games. Not to mention it is on sale at the time I'm posting it so anyone can buy, try and get a chance to experience and like the game for yourself and love it even more through playing it.
Matchmaking works best earlier in the day. It might take a couple of minutes to get a match later in the evening. Overall fun game.

A toxic, unbalanced, broken mess lacking in any genuinely new content other than meaningless background lore that ultimately has little to do with the actual game and a bloated roster that on one side, is almost purely a cosmetic choice. Developers couldn't care less about actually fixing the game, dealing with hackers, or doing a thing about their toxic community that adores bullying players in post-game chat. They most certainly however, love selling NFTs and overpriced cosmetics though, so I guess if you like burning money, knock yourself out.

The licenses and ideas within the game are far better than the actual game or developers. Behaviour has always been incompetent when it comes to development and this hasn't changed in the 6 years the game has been out. There's no hope in sight for this game except if a better dev gets access to the same IPs that have carried this game since their release.

As it is, the game is simply not fun and doesn't encourage fun in any form for either side. The grind has been left to rot with very little changes to the bloodpoint system and has gotten worse with every single dlc that they charge for. Overpriced cosmetics for a game that is likely to be broken in multiple ways at any given point.

You have to force yourself to have a good time with this game. I have 1700 hours in this forsaken pile of code and I'm happier without it. Go play something that values your time.

Apesar de toda a marra, hoje eu recomendo Dead by Daylight, famoso DBDzinho. No começo achei um pouco repetitivo e não muito variado. Mas à medida que fui jogando e entendendo as mecânicas e vantagens presentes no jogo, vi que tem bastante diversidade sim. Os devs conseguiram criar um pega-pega bem divertido que te faz pular da cadeira às vezes. Imersão garantida!
